intro: Saponaria biovulata, commonly known as the red campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of pink to red, woolly flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Saponaria biovulata is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like the carnation and sweet William. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
